answers.answer: protein in urine can finish up leading to preeclampsia it dosent sound like that though id say you were dehydrated that used to happen to me although i drank lots and lots of water and i had no protein what so ever but could be wrong best of luck also protein is what they check for in your urine sample whenever you have an antenatel appointment

have you been to a regular appointment since this started?it could be protien(?) in your urine.  which isn't a good thing but it is something your ob can address.has the extra fluid intake halp the consentration any?keep us informed~nanci

Thanks for the reply.  I have not been to the Dr. since this started but it will be addressed tomorrow for sure.  Also, because I have been urinating so frequently, it has been diluted and I can't tell if it's still cloudy.What does protein in the urine mean???

i was just thinking about you and was going to ask if you found out!  Glad to know it was just a bladder infection I mean they are not great to have but you know lol!  Keep us updated as to what your having!

Just wanted to update that I DO have a mild bladder infection.  I'm glad I got into the Dr. before it became worse!  I also scheduled my first ultrasound for two weeks from today and we're going to find out what we're having!  I can't wait!

hi my name is heather and i am seventeen and i just had my first child. i heard that it was normal to have cloudy urine at the stages of early pregnancy i did and all my friends did because i told them it felt like i was urinating out milk. so yea i think it is normal. i also had a bladder infection and that is more like you urinate alot and it burns and it is yellow

question: Hi!  I asked this question previously and wanted to re post b/c I think it got lost.  :)  I am 15 wks pregnant and have noticed a cloudy urine for the past week or so.  I have no symptoms of any kind of infection. (pain, discomfort, etc)  Is is possible for this to still be a bladder infection?  I have started drinking more liquids, in case the cloudiness was caused by dehydration, and so in the past few days I have had more frequent urination.  I know frequent urination is also a sign of a UTI, but there is no pain associated with it.  If this is an infection, what harms can this do to the baby and what are the treatments for it?  I have a regular dr. appt tomorrow anyway and I will definitely ask him...I just wanted a heads up on what might be causing the cloudy urine!  Thanks so much!Amy
title: Bladder Infection??
